We have developed a ground-breaking medical device for the diagnosis and treatment of the most common heart rhythm disorder, atrial fibrillation - which can cause stroke, heart failure, and other heart-related complications. Kardium's mission is to deliver the best treatment for atrial fibrillation. To achieve this, we have developed The Globe® Pulsed Field System - we have a fantastic technical team that has developed a product with strong, unique, and customer-valued differentiators versus other solutions on the market. We have built connections with key opinion leaders who are already using the Globe System and are helping to tell our story. We have obtained FDA approval and officially begun the commercial launch of the Globe® Pulsed Field System. This is a pivotal and exciting time in our journey, as we bring this life-changing technology to patients! As a UX/UI Designer Co-op, you will work closely with Kardium's UX/UI Team, Product Management, Usability, and Software Development teams to update and promote our design system and design new features/UX improvements for the software that drives user interaction with the Globe system. Please note, this opportunity is a hybrid work arrangement, located in Burnaby, BC. Meaningful work you will be a part of You will engage in activities that develop practical and transferable skills such as: • Participate in a cross-functional UX team. We work rapidly and using principles and methods from lean UX & design thinking: understand the problem/user goal; investigate for user insights, develop design concepts; evaluate concepts for usability & feasibility; implement tested solutions; analyse & improve. • Research and promote inspirational UX/UI design patterns, including competitive analysis and benchmarks from other domains. • Create design documentation to support the design process (wireframes, conceptual designs). • Design detailed UX/UI prototypes and mock-ups to test with users and guide software development. • Communicate design guidance to product development teams. • Participate in hands-on user feedback sessions. Design graphical elements and icons as part of the user experience.? • Why work at Kardium?
